case_circumstances:
The decedent was found by three gentlemen bird hunting in the area of State Route 168, at Mile Marker 19 in Rural Clark County, Nevada. The decedent's body was discovered underneath a sheet of plywood in a small ravine.
Note: Anthropological age estimates are suggestive of the range of 14-25 years old at the time of death. Dental age estimates are suggestive of 35-45 years old.
case_head_hair: Decedent was also wearing a black/gray wig at the time of her death.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is available and entered
case_clothing_on_body: The decedent had a red shirt (size S) with a picture of the Las Vegas Strip Hotels along with the words "Las Vegas" multiple times across it and "I Love Las Vegas" in glitter. The decedent had a short, red sweatshirt type material skirt with "Las Vegas" across the back. The label on the skirt said "One Stop Market" size medium. The decedent had a bra on that was possibly tan in color and the tag stated, "36C Vassarette".
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
